description: Chef Zakir is one of the most popular chefs in Bangladesh, known for his expertise in Bengali and international cuisine. He has hosted several cooking shows on television and has authored many recipe books.

ingredients: Prawns , Coconut milk, Green chili , Onion, Garlic
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pan and fry onion and garlic until golden brown. 
2. Add green chili, prawns, and salt. Cook for 5-6 minutes. 
3. Pour coconut milk and simmer for another 5-7 minutes. 
4. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients: 500g  Ilish, Shorshe,  red chilli ,  vegetable oil , to Glaze Flour , Dash Salt
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Marinate Hilsa fish with turmeric and salt. 2. Fry the fish in oil until golden brown. 3. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add black cumin seeds and green chilies. 4. Add the mustard paste and stir for a minute. 5. Add water and salt to taste. 6. Add the fried fish to the mustard gravy and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 500g telapiya ,  red chilli ,  vegetable oil , to Glaze Flour , Dash Salt
recipes.cooking_method: Wash the fish under the cold tap.Roll in the flour and deep fry in oil until crispy.Lay  on kitchen towel to get rid of the excess oil and serve hot or cold with a slice of lemon.

description: Chef Sanjib is a renowned chef in Bangladesh, famous for his fusion cooking style that combines traditional Bengali flavors with international culinary techniques.

ingredients: Milk, lemon juice, sugar, water, and cardamom.
ground beef , potatoes, carrots, peas, onions
recipes.cooking_method: Boil milk, curdle with lemon juice, strain, form into small balls, boil in sugar syrup with cardamom and water.

ingredients: Rice, Lentils, Onion, Ginger, Cumin, Turmeric, Salt, Water
recipes.cooking_method: Cook all ingredients together in a pressure cooker until soft and mushy, then temper with fried onions and ghee.

description: Chef Munir Ahmed is a well-known chef in Bangladesh who specializes in fusion cuisine. He is known for his innovative recipes that blend Bangladeshi flavors with international cooking techniques.

ingredients: Prawns, Coconut milk, Green chili, Onion, Garlic
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pan and fry onion and garlic until golden brown. 
2. Add green chili, prawns, and salt. Cook for 5-6 minutes. 
3. Pour coconut milk and simmer for another 5-7 minutes. 
4. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients: 500g Hilsa fish,  mustard paste, turmeric powder, red chilli, salt,  green chillies, chopped,  mustard oil
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Marinate Hilsa fish with turmeric and salt. 2. Fry the fish in oil until golden brown. 3. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add black cumin seeds and green chilies. 4. Add the mustard paste and stir for a minute. 5. Add water and salt to taste. 6. Add the fried fish to the mustard gravy and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 500g telapiya , vegetable oil , to Glaze Flour , Dash Salt
recipes.cooking_method: Wash the fish under the cold tap.Roll in the flour and deep fry in oil until crispy.Lay  on kitchen towel to get rid of the excess oil and serve hot or cold with a slice of lemon.
